image.altText: A disability facility in suburban Adelaide.

props.synopsis: A South Australian government aged care home, which looks after 23 people with dementia or complex disabilities, inappropriately used lap belts and other mechanical restraints to stop falls and control residents' behaviour, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: 'It's a human rights tragedy': Aged care facility inappropriately restrained residents

image.altText: A couple of people riding waves on surfboards.

props.synopsis: A surfer has driven himself to hospital after being twice bitten a shark who was reportedly chasing a seal in waters off Kangaroo Island.

title.children: Surfer bitten twice by shark chasing seal off Kangaroo Island

image.altText: A building with grey, green and brown colouring and the words 'Edge Early Learning'

props.synopsis: The Education Standards Board has closed Edge Early Learning Centre at Plympton for 90 days following an investigation into reports of "inadequate supervision" of children.Â

title.children: SA childcare centre 'unsuitable to open' amid supervision concerns

image.altText: A male police officer looking into the distance.

props.synopsis: South Australia's corruption watchdog has cleared Police Commissioner Grant Stevens of a discipline breach for accidentally discharging his firearm during a house raid in the early 1990s.

title.children: SA Police Commissioner cleared over 1990s firearm incident

image.altText: A white sign with two logos and writing on it with a road, a blue sky and bushland behind it.

props.synopsis: The corporation has been fined $2,000 for failing to lodge reports to the Office of the Registrar of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Corporations.

title.children: Indigenous-run corporation convicted, fined for failing to lodge reports

image.altText: A bunch of healthy looking tomatoes on a vine.

props.synopsis: More than a year since South Australia's $230 million tomato and capsicum sector was plunged into turmoil by the first discovery of the tomato brown rugose fruit virus in Australia, the state has been declared free of the exotic disease.

title.children: Relief for fruit producers as SA declared free from brown rugose virus

image.altText: A smaller Kangaroo stands in front of a larger kangaroo in high grass.

props.synopsis: Farmers are calling for a cull of kangaroos, which they say are being forced onto farmland by drought and dry conditions and consuming what little feed and water they have.Â

title.children: Kangaroos add pressure on drought-hit farmers by eating scarce feed

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: Police say they have conducted a "significant" aerial search of a property in South Australia's mid-north, where a four-year-old boy went missing 10 days ago.

title.children: 'Significant' aerial search for four-year-old Gus conducted over the weekend

image.altText: A vast waterway from above

props.synopsis:
The floodwaters which have created an expansive inland oasis on the usually arid salt beds of Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre have reached a peak, and are beginning to evaporate, a local pilot says.

Â

title.children: Floodwaters 'transform whole desert' as Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre reaches peak

image.altText: An empty potato shelf at Woolworths in South Australia.

props.synopsis: South Australia produces 80 per cent of Australia's fresh potatoes, but extreme weather and drought across the state are causing a major shortage.Â

title.children: Customers face empty shelves as farmers battle potato shortage

image.altText: Two teenage Indigenous boys fishing in the Darling River at Wilcannia, with a man in a blue shirt watching on.

props.synopsis: After decades of lobbying and design controversy, the New South Wales government says it needs another $30â40 million to proceed with the Wilcannia Weir upgrade.

title.children: Outback water project unlikely due to $30m shortfall, minister says

image.altText: Charlie Kirk is stood with a microphone in one hand and a red cap in the other.

props.synopsis: The Australian affiliate of late right-wing activist Charlie Kirk's Turning Point USA is moving into South Australia ahead of next year's state election, but some politicians say the group is "out of step with mainstream values".

title.children: Turning Point Australia moves into SA, ahead of state election

image.altText: A close up image of an SA Police car.

props.synopsis: A Port Pirie woman has been bailed after police downgraded a murder charge laid over the death of a man to aggravated assault.

title.children: Woman's murder charge downgraded over Port Pirie death

image.altText: firefighters carry a hiker at night in a tv screencap

props.synopsis: Hundreds of hikers are still trapped at an elevation of more than 4,900 metres as rescuers work to clear deep snow.

title.children: Hundreds of Everest hikers still awaiting rescue, 4,900 metres up

image.altText: A red sign on a bus shelter reading Buy the Best, Buy SA Seafood

props.synopsis: While industry and government tell consumers South Australian seafood is safe, consumer demand is still down amid the algal bloom, with businesses concerned they may not survive.

title.children: Seafood 'good as it's ever been' as sellers fear algal bloom message not getting through

image.altText: Masooma smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Masooma came to Adelaide as a refugee from Afghanistan in 2016, and has become the carer of a young girl from a similar cultural background. Experts say it is important carers reflected the diversity of children in care.

title.children: For Afghan refugee Masooma, fostering a child has given her a sense of freedom

image.altText: A man in a white shirt and a serious expression looks into the camera.

props.synopsis: A fractured but defiant Israel is struggling to assert itself at home and abroad, on the anniversary of a Hamas attack that triggered the current war in Gaza.

title.children: After two years of war, some Israelis feel a 'reckoning' is coming

image.altText: A man with only one eye stands next to a woman with blonde hair.

props.synopsis: A young father who lost his eye after contracting a rare infection is suing the hospital that treated him, alleging it ignored his requests to investigate his condition properly.Â

title.children: 'I feel like I'm dying': Father loses eye after hospital's delayed diagnosis

image.altText: A bald man with sunglasses resting on his forehead looks straight at the camera.

props.synopsis: The state of WA is appealing a record $2.8 million compensation payment awarded to Dion Barber, who suffered repeated sexual abuse while in state care during the 1980s and 1990s.

title.children: State of WA appeals $2.8m compensation for child sex abuse survivor

image.altText: Two women hugging each other, with one crying on the otherâs shoulder.

props.synopsis: Rescue teams worked around the clock through narrow gaps in the rubble of Sidoarjo's Al Khoziny Islamic Boarding School while risking further collapse to reach anyone still alive.

title.children: 'Guys smashed through a wall': How school kids survived deadly quake

image.altText: Sean has a serious expression while staring straight ahead.

props.synopsis: WA's police commissioner rules out reopening a case in which a man alleges he was choked by an off-duty police officer, in front of his daughter, during a fight.

title.children: Commissioner rules out charging off-duty sergeant who allegedly choked driver

image.altText: a man standing out the front of a house holding nrl teams bulldog flags

props.synopsis: The 60-year-old accused of shooting at over a dozen random members of the public in suburban Sydney has faced a magistrate after two lawyers got into an argument over who was representing him.

title.children: Lawyers' spat as alleged Croydon Park gunman fronts court

image.altText: The supermoon as it rises over Mt Coot-tha in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Our skies will be graced by up to four consecutive supermoons over the next months. Here's why they happen, and how we can end up with multiple supermoons in a row.

title.children: A trifecta of supermoons starts with tonight's harvest moon

image.altText: An aerial image shows a helicopter on its back on a road surrounded by emergency vehicles.

props.synopsis: Three people have sustained critical injuries after a helicopter crashed on a Sacramento freeway in the US.

title.children: Witnesses lift helicopter, free person trapped after crash in US

image.altText: A close up of a man with his mouth open.

props.synopsis: The daughter of the late actor Robin Williams has condemned AI-generated content featuring her father's likeness.

title.children: 'It's NOT what he'd want': Robin Williams's daughter calls out AI videos

image.altText: Jaffles on a tray covered in sugar, with milk and coffee.

props.synopsis: An oatmeal-filled jaffle made by a Melbourne food stylist and flavoured with Bundaberg Rum and bananas wins over judges in Scotland.

title.children: Australian wins with a jaffle at World Porridge Making Championship

image.altText: Portrait of Pulp frontman Jarvis Cocker peering at camera with cross-hatch light behind him

props.synopsis: Love was "always problematic" for Jarvis Cocker, who fronts Britpop icons Pulp. But after decades of cynical songs on the subject, he's beginning to change his tune on romance. Â

title.children: Pulp's Jarvis Cocker has a wild wedding story few will top

image.altText: A netballer catches the ball in front of her, with a defender by her hip

props.synopsis: Australian coach Stacey Marinkovich says she needs to try different combinations ahead of the Test series against New Zealand.

title.children: Diamonds looking to change things up against Proteas

image.altText: An adult whale and a whale calf breaching.

props.synopsis: Once hunted almost to extinction, the population of humpback whales currently migrating down Australia's east coast has bounced back and is now greater than before whaling.

title.children: These whales were hunted to 150 individuals. Now there's 50,000 of them

image.altText: SUV with bullet holes

props.synopsis: A major police operation has taken place in Sydney's south-west after tactical operations officers conducted a "high risk" arrest on a suburban street.

title.children: Cars left with bullet holes, windows smashed after dramatic arrest in Sydney

image.altText: Nick Daicos of the Magpies celebrates a goal, yelling and punching his fist in the air

props.synopsis: The reported attempts to lure Nick Daicos away from Collingwood have headlined the second day of the AFL trade period. Look back at how all the day's trade news unfolded in our blog.

title.children: Rivals reportedly launch bid to lure Nick Daicos from Collingwood

image.altText: Doctor tools hanging on the wall of a medical consultation room.

props.synopsis: These five charts give us a glimpse into what the current state of general practice looks like in Australia.

title.children: What the Health of the Nation report tells us about GPs by numbers

image.altText: A bowler walking back to his mark, about to catch the cricket ball with one hand

props.synopsis: Victoria has upset reigning Sheffield Shield holders South Australia at the Adelaide Oval.

title.children: Vics survive hat-trick ball to secure win, Tasmania digs deep for draw

image.altText: People stand at the water's edge.

props.synopsis: A multi-agency search of the Peel River began on Monday night after police were told the teen had entered the water and failed to resurface.

title.children: Body recovered during search for 15yo swimmer in Tamworth
